data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Good breakfast spot. Work group stopped here before a customer meeting. The chairs and booth are a little rough around the edges, but the food and service were great. The portions were decent size and came out quickly. I'd recommend coming in for breakfast.

data.title: Soul Diner
data.text: Hotel doorman recommended, though he had not eaten at Fife's. Walked over mid afternoon hot day through a crumbling streetscape, looking forward to the traditional Southern menu. Not crowded, and after studying the daily specials on the wall, and not seeing the advertised chicken livers in the trays, asked, and received with the addition of gravy. Chose the cabbage and fried green tomatoes as side dishes, along with sweet tea. At 3 in the afternoon, cafeteria food usually suffers a bit since it's been around for a while. Nonetheless I kept up my membership in the clean plate club and ate every bit on my plate. Didn't finish the cornbread on the side though because I was feeling the lack of butter. Service was friendly, throughout, and learned that each person working has their own tip jar - line server, cashier, and table service. I was happy to acknowledge each of them.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Anytime I need a home cooked meal, be it breakfast or lunch, I can always stop here to get some nice food!! And momma Doris is really sweet!!

data.title: Local, down-home cooking but just ok
data.text:
My cab driver said that Fife's is the place to go for traditional local fare. It is essentially a buffet line with all the food pre-cooked in warming trays. The fried chicken was very good but the meat loaf was so-so. The sweet potatoes (I LOVE sweet potatoes) were so syrupy that they were dripping. 

The service was GREAT. Very nice, hard-working, attentive people.

This is a great joint to visit - once.

data.title: Great Southern Food
data.text: My friend took us there for lunch. The food portions were so worth it and the taste was awesome. If I ever visit AL again I will definitely go back.

data.title: Birthday breakfast
data.text: The food taste good however I could not stay out of the bathroom once I left this place!! Don't know what went wrong but that was the case

data.title: Fife's
data.text: Great southern food. From the fried chicken to candied yams, it was great! Dine in or take out, you will leave stuffed!

data.title: Good food, friendly and cheap
data.text: After too many meals on the road in bright, trendy eateries, this was a pleasure.  Not pretty outside, pretty plain inside, but a line of good solid food like grandma used to make.  My baked chicken and greens were excellent.  I was there to eat alone....so I was actually grateful for the news playing on a TV on the wall.  Low prices and friendly service.  I haven't had breakfast there yet, but I would bet anything they know how to  make real good grits.

data.title: Don't let its looks fool you!
data.text: Fife's has been around my whole life and the area it's in has certainly declined. The building doesn't have its own parking lot on the side plus metered street parking, Inside it's nothing fancy, but it's large & clean & serves cafeteria-style good ol' Southern home cooking. The guy who's usually behind the counter tries for humor, but it doesn't come across too great. Anyway, the food is wonderful. Good cakes & pies, usually a peach cobbler & banana pudding. Collards, real mashed potatoes, cornbread, country fried steak or pork chops, trout almondine, fried chicken, sweet tea, & more. Booths & tables are available & if you know the courthouse folks, you'll probably recognize some of the attorneys & judges enjoying their own lunches. They're open early for breakfast, too, but I've never tried it. At about $8.50 a plate, you'll get out for around $11 each after paying for a beverage, tax, & dropping a dollar for the waitress.

data.title: "Good Down Home Food"
data.text: Nothing fancy, just some of the best down home cooking that you'll every eat. There's always a good selection of food to choose from and the owner always greets you with a smile. I've been coming here for 25 years and I've yet to have a bad experience. If you want fancy, then go to a French restaurant! If you want good home cooking, then Fife's is your place!

data.title: Great southern greasy spoon experience.   Low prices, comfort food.
data.text: Found this on YELP! while staying in Birmingham on business for the first time.  I wanted to find a 'non-standard' breakfast spot.   This place is downtown and isn't much to look at from the outside.  But it's clear the locals breakfast here, and I understand why.  A basic breakfast menu, and the prices are right.  I imagine this place hasn't changed much in the last 50 years.  The waitresses were very friendly.

data.title: Good Food For the Soul
data.text: had good soul food  I thought a little to pricie for the amount you receive but I guess you have to make profit if you are to stay in business but should have deals like drink added for 50 cent more

data.title: Great food, good people
data.text: I had heard of this place from some, and I decided to try it out. The food here is served in a cafeteria-like serving line, and includes many Soul Foods. I would more than likely return here again.

data.title: Good Old Fashion Southern Hospitality
data.text: I visited Fife after visiting the 16th Street Baptist Church. The staff was very very friendly and welcoming. The food was good and authentic, definity not for calorie counters. if you want real soul food, this is the place. LOL!. I would definitely visit again when I'm in Birmingham again. Southern Hopistality at it's very very best.

data.title: Cafeteria style greatness of yesteryear
data.text: This place is a local landmark. Old school cafeteria steam table food line with a mind boggling selection of meats and fresh vegetable dishes. If home cooked soul food is your craving  in downtown Birmingham, this is your place. Very good fresh food. Very busy during peak hours.

data.title: Friendly Service of Old Fashioned Classics
data.text: I went with a group of Civil Rights pilgrims to various sites in Georgia and Alabama, and on the second day we had lunch here.  We were a party of 18, and they set aside a long table for us (four people had to sit at a separate booth).  The servers were all courteous and friendly, and when we left they offered each of us a complementary sweet tea to go (it was in the upper 90s).  I had fried chicken with gravy, fried green tomatoes and collard greens.  I was happy with all of it, particularly the fried green tomatoes whose coating was crisp and the tomatoes were juicy.  The vegetables were particularly good, some people were not as impressed with some of the proteins.  But you couldn't ask for kinder or friendlier treatment.  The decor is basic, but the prices were bargains.

data.title: A tad on the greasy side but okay
data.text: It was slightly greasy but not as bad as a Waffle House. I liked it but my significant other did not. It was decently priced and had a good selection.

data.title: Great food nice employee
data.text:
I have been going here since i was a little girl i am now 19 and the food is still amazing! 
I love fifes!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I was impressed with this restaurant.  Typical downtown look, but the food inside was beyond my expectations.  Enjoyed the atmosphere and the people.  Food was very good in my opinion and the sweet tea just perfect.  They should bottle it and sell it.

data.title: Average southern food
data.text: Average food, good service. Conbread dressing was spoiled it was very hot. Yams very good and the greens were good.
